result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Patrick Pickett is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges. On one or more other charges, Daniel Patrick Pickett was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Patrick Pickett is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Attempt Kidnapping/Seize or Confine w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.31(1)(b).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Hit and Run [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty-Hit and Run], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh. [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh. [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh. [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Daniel Patrick Pickett was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
